required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcomes of a Trifocal IOL in Post-refractive Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Outcomes of a Trifocal IOL in Post-refractive Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the prediction error of ORA vs formula for post-LASIK cataract patients when PanOptix IOL was implanted. Using post-operative outcomes to determine if preoperative IOL calculations, including Barrett TK, Barrett Universal II, Hill RBF, ASCRS post-refractive calculator, or intraoperative aberrometry is more accurate when the two methods disagree in patients who have had previous refractive surgery undergo cataract surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will be non-interventional with data being collected prospectively and retrospectively between at least two surgical sites. All subjects will have previous LASIK and be at least 3 months post op PanOptix implantation. The study will enroll up to 200 patients and a statistical database will be created.

primary_outcome.measure: To determine if preoperative IOL calculations or intraoperative aberrometry is more accurate when the two methods disagree in patients who have had previous refractive surgery undergo cataract surgery.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of eyes within +/- .5D of target for each formula and ORA. Overall % of eyes that have a disagreement between the two methods

secondary_outcome.description: Monocular Uncorrected Distance, Intermediate, Near Visual Acuity
Manifest refraction, Best Corrected Distance Visual Acuity, Distance Corrected Intermediate, and Near Visual Acuity
Binocular Uncorrected Distance, Intermediate, Near Visual Acuity, Best Corrected Distance Visual Acuity, Distance Corrected Intermediate, Near Visual Acuity
Percentage of eyes with Uncorrected Distance Visual Acuity of 20/20 or better, 20/25 or better, and 20/30 or better
Percentage of eyes with Uncorrected Corrected Intermediate Visual Acuity and Distance Corrected Intermediate Visual Acuity 20/20 or better, 20/25 or better, and 20/30 or better
Percentage of eyes with Uncorrected Distance Near Visual Acuity and Distance Corrected Near Visual Acuity of 20/20 or better, 20/25 or better, and 20/30 or better

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's quality of vision and reported side-effects

intervention.description: Trifocal IOL with ORA in post refractive patients

study_pop.textblock: Charts from up to 200 myopic post-refractive patients who have received PanOptix will be reviewed at at least two Vance Thompson Vision sites (Fargo, ND and Sioux Falls, SD). All patients will have had ORA used during the cataract surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previous myopic refractive surgery
- At least 3 months post op cataract surgery with a trifocal IOL
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pre-existing or subsequent eye condition that interferes with accurate data collection (retinal detachment, etc.)
